com.martinambrus.adminAnything

Class AA_API

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.martinambrus.adminAnything.AA_API

  • public final class AA_API
extends java.lang.Object
    API for AdminAnything used by AA's own procedures but also publicly available to other plugins.

    • Method Detail

      • getAaName

        public static java.lang.String getAaName()
        Returns name of the AdminAnything plugin. If it ever changes, we don't have to string-replace all AdminAnything names in all files where console is used to log exceptions. ```java Bukkit.getLogger().warning("[" + AA_API.getAaName() + "] Something's gone wrong :-P"); ```
        Parameters:
        key - The config key we want to return a string value for.
        Returns:
        Returns the string value from AA's configuration.

      • getConfigBoolean

        public static boolean getConfigBoolean(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a boolean value from AA's configuration. We don't return the whole Config class and let methods use that, since that could very well result in other plugins tampering with AA's config. ```java boolean chatNickClicksFeature = AA_API.getConfigBoolean("features.chatnicklinks.enabled"); ```
        Parameters:
        key - The config key we want to return a boolean value for.
        Returns:
        Returns the boolean value from AA's configuration.

      • getConfigString

        public static java.lang.String getConfigString(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a string value from AA's configuration. We don't return the whole Config class and let methods use that, since that could very well result in other plugins tampering with AA's config. ```java String chatNickClicksColor = AA_API.getConfigString("chatNickClickActions." + key + ".color"); ```
        Parameters:
        key - The config key we want to return a string value for.
        Returns:
        Returns the string value from AA's configuration.

      • getConfigSectionKeys

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getConfigSectionKeys(java.lang.String key)
        Returns keys of a configuration section from AA's configuration. We don't return the whole Config class and let methods use that, since that could very well result in other plugins tampering with AA's config. ```java for (final String key : AA_API.getConfigSectionKeys("chatNickClickActions")) { // do something with the configuration key name ("key" variable) here } ```
        Parameters:
        key - The configuration section the keys for we want to return.
        Returns:
        Returns keys for the requested configuration section.

      • getAaDataDir

        public static java.lang.String getAaDataDir()
        Returns the data folder for AdminAnything. This is used in various warning messages in console to inform Admins where to search for files they need to update (for example to turn off statistics etc.) ```java virtualPermissionsList.save(new File(AA_API.getAaDataDir(), "perms.yml")); ```
        Returns:
        Returns the full data folder path for AdminAnything.

        public static java.lang.String getAaVersion()
        Gets the plugin version ```java Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "You are running AdminAnything, version " + AA_API.getAaVersion()); ```
        Returns:
        Returns version of AdminAnything.

      • isFeatureEnabled

        public static boolean isFeatureEnabled(java.lang.String featureConfigKey)
        Checks whether a feature in AdminAnything is enabled via config. ```java if (AA_API.isFeatureEnabled("listcommands")) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "Listing of commands is enabled in AdminAnything."); } ```
        Parameters:
        featureConfigKey - The feature name in the config file (for example "addperm" to check the "features.addperm.enabled" key).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the requested feature is enabled, false otherwise.

      • getMaxRecordsPerPage

        public static double getMaxRecordsPerPage()
        Gets the maximum records (lines) per page displayable in various AdminAnything listings, such as list of commands, permissions or conflicts. ```java if (recordsNumber > AA_API.getMaxRecordsPerPage()) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "Pagination should be enabled here, as we've requested more records than we allow per one page."); } ```
        Returns:
        Returns the maximum number of records (lines) per one page to be returned to the client.

      • getDebug

        public static boolean getDebug()
        Gets this plugin's debug state. ```java if (AA_API.getDebug()) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("debug", "AdminAnything debug information line."); } ```
        Returns:
        Returns true if debug is turned ON, false otherwise.

      • getBuiltInCommands

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getBuiltInCommands()
        Get list of built-in commands for a Spigot server. ```java if (AA_API.getBuiltInCommands().contains("ban")) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "/ban is a Minecraft built-in server command."); } ```
        Returns:
        Returns a hard-coded list of core commands from the CommandMap of Spigot as of version 1.12. There are commands from all - Minecraft, CraftBukkit and Spigot.

        public static boolean configContainsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Checks whether the given key is present in the plugin configuration. ```java if (AA_API.configContainsKey("listcommandsDefaults.showdescriptions")) { // config contains a default setting for showing/hiding command descriptions // when using /aa_listcommands } ```
        Returns:
        Returns true if the key is present in configuration, false otherwise.

      • isListenerRegistered

        public static boolean isListenerRegistered(java.lang.String listenerName)
        Checks whether a named listener is already registered with AdminAnything. This method is used to prevent the same event listener being registered more than once. ```java if (!AA_API.isListenerRegistered("chatJoinLeaveClicks")) { // register an event listener to display join and leave click links next to nicknames // in chat } ```
        Parameters:
        listenerName - Name of the listener to check for.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given listener name is already registered, false otherwise.

      • startRequiredListener

        public static void startRequiredListener(java.lang.String listenerName)
        Registers a listener if that listener was not registered already. Can be used to lazy-register listeners from various listener classes. ```java // register an event listener to display join and leave click links next to nicknames in chat AA_API.startRequiredListener("chatJoinLeaveClicks"); ```
        Parameters:
        listenerName - ClassName of the listener to register. This class will then be loaded from com.martinambrus.adminAnything.listeners.[[ listenerName ]]

      • startRequiredListener

        public static void startRequiredListener(java.lang.String listenerName,
                         org.bukkit.event.Listener listenerClassInstance)
        Registers a listener if that listener was not registered already. Can be used to lazy-register listeners from various listener classes. ```java AA_API.startRequiredListener("yourListenerName", yourListenerClassInstance); ```
        Parameters:
        listenerName - An arbitrary name of the listener to register. AA uses its feature names to register event listeners this way.
        listenerClassInstance - The actual instance of the listener class we'd like to register.

      • generateConsoleWarning

        public static void generateConsoleWarning(java.lang.String warningText)
        Generates a console warning. In AdminAnything, this method is used when AA is starting or reloading to show any and all error messages that a server Admin should be aware of. ```java AA_API.generateConsoleWarning("You shouldn't eat yellow snow!"); ```
        Parameters:
        warningText - The actual text to display in console.

      • checkPerms

        public static boolean checkPerms(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                 java.lang.String permsQuery,
                 boolean showResultToSender)
        Uses a query parsing algorithm to check for one or many permission nodes given via the permsQuery parameter. ```java if (AA_API.checkPerms(sender, "my_permission", true) { // do your stuff // ... if the commandSender (sender) does not have the relevant permission, // an error message will be displayed to them } ``` ```java if (AA_API.checkPerms(sender, "(perm1 OR perm2) AND perm3", false) { // do your stuff // ... in this case, no error message is displayed to the command sender (last parameter is false) // and you can handle this case with your own logic } ```
        Parameters:
        sender - The CommandSender who we're checking the permission(s) for.
        permsQuery - An SQL-like query containing all the parameters that we need to check for. The syntax is the same as used in SQL queries with AND / OR sections. Parenthesis are important, as is remembering the general rule of operator priority, which says that AND has a higher priority over OR. That means that any AND statements will be evaluated first. Example: perm1 AND perm2 -> will check for both, perm1 and perm2 permissions Example: perm1 OR perm2 -> will check for either perm1 or perm2 permission Example: perm1 AND perm2 OR perm3 -> will check for either perm1 + perm2, or the perm3 permission Example: perm1 AND (perm2 OR perm3) -> the use of parenthesis now changes the previous example, so perm1 + EITHER ONE of perm2 or perm3 permissions will be checked
        Returns:
        Returns true if the sender has the requested permission(s), false otherwise.

      • isVaultEnabled

        public static boolean isVaultEnabled()
        Checks whether Vault is enabled on the server. ```java if (AA_API.isVaultEnabled()) { // Vault is enabled, we should hook in to check player permissions } ```
        Returns:
        Returns true if Vault is enabled, false otherwise.

      • commandMapContainsKey

        public static boolean commandMapContainsKey(java.lang.String key)
                                     throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                            java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                            java.lang.SecurityException,
                                            java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Checks whether the command map contains the given key. The key will be a full command name, such as "essentials:ban". ```java if (AA_API.commandMapContainsKey("essentials:ban")) { // essentials:ban found to be a real command from the command map // and we can immediately execute it } ```
        Parameters:
        key - The actual command name we want to look up in the command map.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command map contains the given command, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When access is denied to the commandMap or knownCommands field.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - When there is a get() method missing from the knownCommands field.
        java.lang.SecurityException - When private fields cannot be accessed due to a security restriction.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - When we try to invoke get() on knownCommands with invalid commandMap parameter.
        java.rmi.AccessException - When we don't have the permission to access the knownCommands field of commandMap.

      • getCommandMapKey

        public static org.bukkit.command.Command getCommandMapKey(java.lang.String key)
                                                   throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                                                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                          java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                          java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Retrieves a actual command from the command map according to the given command name. ```java // ban ZathrusWriter using essentials' ban command AA_API.getCommandMapKey("essentials:ban").execute(Bukkit.getConsoleSender(), "ban", "ZathrusWriter"); ```
        Parameters:
        key - The command name we want to retrieve the actual command for.
        Returns:
        Returns the actual command retrieved from the command map according to the given command name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When access is denied to the commandMap or knownCommands field.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - When there is a get() method missing from the knownCommands field.
        java.lang.SecurityException - When private fields cannot be accessed due to a security restriction.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - When we try to invoke get() on knownCommands with invalid commandMap parameter.
        java.rmi.AccessException - When we don't have the permission to access the knownCommands field of commandMap.

      • getCommandMapCopy

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.bukkit.command.Command> getCommandMapCopy()
                                                                                    throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                                                                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                                                           java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                                                           java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Returns a copy of the entry set for the command map. This is used in the runnable part of /aa_checkcommandconflicts and is coded this way, so we don't give write access to the actual command map. ```java for (final Entry pair : AA_API.getCommandMapCopy().entrySet()) { // pair.getKey() will contain the command name of each command registered via CommandMap on the server // pair.getKey() will contain the actual command registered via CommandMap } ```
        Returns:
        Returns a clone of the server's command map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When access is denied to the commandMap or knownCommands field.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - When there is a get() method missing from the knownCommands field.
        java.lang.SecurityException - When private fields cannot be accessed due to a security restriction.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - When we try to invoke get() on knownCommands with invalid commandMap parameter.
        java.rmi.AccessException - When we don't have the permission to access the knownCommands field of commandMap.

      • getClearCommand

        public static java.lang.String[] getClearCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Returns a clear command name from the command given. Used when a command is prefixed (i.e. minecraft:ban or essentials:ban). ```java // will hold "ban" String clearBan = AA_API.getClearCommand("minecraft:ban"); ```
        Parameters:
        cmd - The actual command to return stripped of dots and colons.
        Returns:
        Returns a command that's stripped-down version of the original commands, i.e. without any dots or colons.

      • getPluginForCommand

        public static java.lang.String getPluginForCommand(java.lang.String key,
                                   org.bukkit.command.Command value)
                                            throws java.io.InvalidClassException
        Returns name of the plugin to which the given command belongs. ```java for (final Entry pair : AA_API.getCommandMapCopy().entrySet()) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "Command '" + pair.getKey() + "' is from the plugin '" + AA_API.getPluginForCommand(pair.getKey(), pair.getValue()) + "'"); } ```
        Parameters:
        key - The commands name to lookup a plugin name for.
        value - The actual command we're trying to lookup a plugin for. Used for a short-circuited version of plugin checking when Command is actually an instance of PluginCommand, from which the plugin name retrieval is really trivial.
        Returns:
        Returns name of the plugin to which the given command belongs.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidClassException - When this plugin's class file is not found in the current classLoader.

      • getCommandContainingPlugins

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCommandContainingPlugins(java.lang.String command,
                                                           boolean... extendCorePluginNames)
                                                                    throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                                                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                                           java.io.InvalidClassException,
                                                                           java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                                           java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Returns a list of plugin names that contain the given command. ```java for (final String pluginName : AA_API.getCommandContainingPlugins("ban")) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "Command 'ban' found in plugin '" + pluginName); } ```
        Parameters:
        command - The actual command we need to check all plugins for.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of plugins that contain the command in question.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.AccessException - AccessException When we don't have the permission to access the knownCommands field of commandMap.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - When access is denied to the commandMap or knownCommands field.
        java.io.InvalidClassException - When a class for any of the server plugins cannot be found within the current classLoader.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - When we try to invoke get() on knownCommands with invalid commandMap parameter.
        java.lang.SecurityException - When private fields cannot be accessed due to a security restriction.
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - When there is a get() method missing from the knownCommands field.

      • isAaCoreCommand

        public static boolean isAaCoreCommand(java.lang.String[] cmd)
        Checks whether the given command is AdminAnything's internal command. Used to prevent disabling or otherwise messing with our commands, so admins can undo things when they make a mistake (which they wouldn't be able to if they disabled certain combination of commands of AdminAnything without stopping the server, editing config.yml and re-starting). ```java if (AA_API.isAaCoreCommand("aa_reload")) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "Command /aa_reload() is indeed an AdminAnything core command :)"); } ```
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the command in question comes from AdminAnything, false otherwise.

      • guessPluginFromClass

        public static java.lang.String guessPluginFromClass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
                                             throws java.io.InvalidClassException
        Returns the plugin name from the given class, which should be one of the command is was just being executed.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class of the command being executed.
        Returns:
        Returns the name of plugin containing the command currently called.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidClassException - When this plugin's class file is not found in the current classLoader.

      • getCommandsConfigurationValue

        public static java.lang.String getCommandsConfigurationValue(java.lang.String which,
                                             java.lang.String key)
                                                      throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Retrieves a value to be used in place of the original command which was ignored, muted, overridden etc.
        Parameters:
        which - The actual configuration file to look in for the value.

        Returns:
        Returns the replacement command value we asked for from the loaded configuration.

        java.security.InvalidParameterException - When the given which parameter does not conform to any known list of commands.

        Returns an unmodifiable map of muted commands.

      • getPluginIgnoreCase

        public static org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin getPluginIgnoreCase(java.lang.String pluginName)
        Returns plugin name from the cache of lowercased plugins as opposed to the Bukkit.getPluginManager().getPlugin() case-sensitive getting. ```java // realPluginName will be set to "AdminAnything" for this one String realPluginName = AA_API.getPluginIgnoreCase("ADminAnyThINg"); ```
        Parameters:
        pluginName - Name of the plugin (in any text case, i.e. plugin / Plugin / PLuGIn) we wish to retrieve the original name for.
        Returns:
        Returns the original name of the given plugin as it's known on the server.

      • parsePluginJARLocation

        public static java.lang.String parsePluginJARLocation(java.lang.Class<?> commandClass)
                                               throws java.io.InvalidClassException
        Attempts to retrieve a location of the plugin's class file within the currently loaded JAR archives structure. This method is used if we can't determine which plugin fired up a command directly. Usually this means that the plugin uses a different classLoader to make its magic work on multiple platforms, such as Spigot, Sponge and others. ```java // usage in Commands class Command value = [value_from_a_method_call]; String commandLocationParsed = this.plugin.getPluginUtils().parsePluginJARLocation(value.getClass()); // then we can actually get a plugin name from this command's class location String pluginName = this.plugin.getPluginUtils().getPluginNameViaClassPathsMap(commandLocationParsed); ```
        Parameters:
        commandClass - The actual command class that has executed the command.
        Returns:
        Returns the JAR location of the given command class, and thus the plugin itself.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidClassException - When this command's class cannot be found within the current class loader.

      • classMapContainsKey

        public static boolean classMapContainsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Checks for existence of a command location key in the class map. Since we don't want to expose the whole map, as it would be writable by anyone, we just expose this method directly here. ```java if (AA_API.classMapContainsKey(someRandomAdminAnythingCommandClassMapLocation)) { pluginName = AA_API.getClassMapKey(someRandomAdminAnythingCommandClassMapLocation); } ```
        Parameters:
        key - The key we want to check for in the class map.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the given key exists within the class map, false otherwise.

      • getClassMapKey

        public static java.lang.String getClassMapKey(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves a key from the class map cache. Since we don't want to expose the whole map, as it would be writable by anyone, we just expose this method directly here. ```java if (AA_API.classMapContainsKey(someRandomAdminAnythingCommandClassMapLocation)) { pluginName = AA_API.getClassMapKey(someRandomAdminAnythingCommandClassMapLocation); } ```
        Parameters:
        key - The key we want to get from the class map.
        Returns:
        Returns the requested key from the class map.

      • getCleanPluginName

        public static java.lang.String getCleanPluginName(java.lang.String pluginWithCommand,
                                  boolean returnRealPluginName)
        Returns a clear name of the plugin from a string which may contain the plugin along with a command (essentials:ban) or along with a core alias (Core -> minecraft:ban). ```java // essentials will be set to "essentials" String essentials = AA_API.getCleanPluginName("essentials:ban"); // ban will be set to "ban" String ban = aa_plugin_instance.getPluginUtils().getCleanPluginName("Core -> ban"); ```
        Parameters:
        pluginWithCommand -
        Returns:

      • getAvailableNewVersion

        public static java.lang.String getAvailableNewVersion()
        Returns the newVersionAvailable value, be it null or a real new version string. ```java String newVersion = AA_API.getAvailableNewVersion(); if (newVersion != null) { Bukkit.getLogger().log("info", "New AdminAnything version (" + newVersion + ") was released. Download your copy today!"); } ```
        Returns:
        Returns the value of newVersionAvailable. It will be null if no new version is available, a real version number string otherwise.
